properties.areaDesc: McIntosh; La Moure; Stutsman; Logan; Dickey; Kidder
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 2:14PM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind
chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch,
blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast North Dakota.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM CST Thursday. For
the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday
evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold
wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little
as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Cover all exposed skin.

Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the
latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
